file.spreadsheet

Class SpreadsheetReaderService

  • java.lang.Object
    • file.spreadsheet.SpreadsheetReaderService

  • public class SpreadsheetReaderService
extends java.lang.Object
    A service which can be used to read and parse the content of a spreadsheet, given a splitter to identify the columns.
    Author:
    Pascal Nguyen

      SpreadsheetReaderService()

      • loadSpreadsheet

        public void loadSpreadsheet(java.lang.String filePath,
                            SpreadsheetSplitter splitter)
        Read the spreadsheet at the given path and load the data. In order to use the data retrieved, please see getSpreadsheetContent().
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path of the file to read. This parameter can either be a relative path or a full path.
        splitter - The splitter with which to identify the columns in the file

      • getSpreadsheetColumnNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSpreadsheetColumnNames()
        Get the name of the columns of the loaded spreadsheet. Please remember to load the spreadsheet with loadSpreadsheet(String, SpreadsheetSplitter) before calling this method.
        Returns:
        See description

      • getSpreadsheetContent

        public java.lang.String[][] getSpreadsheetContent()
        Get the content of the loaded spreadsheet. Please remember to load the spreadsheet with loadSpreadsheet(String, SpreadsheetSplitter) before calling this method.
        Returns:
        See description

      • getIndexForColumnName

        public int getIndexForColumnName(java.lang.String columnName)
        Get the matrix column index for the given column name. Please remember to load the spreadsheet with loadSpreadsheet(String, SpreadsheetSplitter) before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column for which to get the index
        Returns:
        See description

        public int getLines()
        Get the amount of lines for the loaded spreadsheet. Please remember to load the spreadsheet with loadSpreadsheet(String, SpreadsheetSplitter) before calling this method.

        See description
